description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Tokyo,Japan,disabled,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~18:42:48 - 18:47:33

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Sarimukti Village,Jakarta,Indonesia,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Dadah - Sarimukti Village, Jakarta, Indonesia - Sundanese (Global Lives Project, 2008) ~14:27:34 - 14:42:34

description: In this clip, Jamila is at home. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Jamila Jad - Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon - Arabic (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~19:58:00 - 20:13:01

description: In this clip, light breaks in Ngwale. Edith and Memory are down at the stream doing dishes and chatting. They discuss a mysterious dog, what awaits them at school, and and an accusation about little farts. Memory notices the way flowers fall from a tall tree, and she wants to climb it. They return home after doing the dishes and Edith and Memory are sent to the well for more water by their mother. Memory asks her sister about a lurking owl. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Ngwale Village,Malawi,student,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Edith Kaphuka - Ngwale Village, Zomba, Malawi - Nyanja (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~05:15:42 - 05:30:43

description: In this clip, Muttu and Satya walk towards the hill top which is the sunset point. Muttu explains the history to Satya. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~17:19:29 - 17:34:33

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dusan Lazic - Vojka, Srem District, Serbia - Serbian (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~19:45:16 - 20:21:35

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Zhanna Dosmailova, a child from Vannovka, Kazakhstan. She was 5 years old at the time of the shoot. Zhanna Dosmailova has grown up in an orphanage, though she is not an orphan herself. Her mother is the orphanage's director, and her father is its driver and maintenance manager. They live in Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, near the Tien Shan mountains. Five-year-old Zhanna and her two older brothers often play Wii and other games with the orphans, many of whom are Russian. She begins school in 2010. This video was produced by Simone Goldsmith, Nobuhiro Awata, Ruchika Muchala, Marco Lüthy, Asel Orumbayeva, and Lindee Hoshikawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Rael is at a dance competition for children. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~17:36:55 - 17:48:59

description: The K165 train line from Xi'an to Kunming is running behind schedule due to heavy rain. Ruixian Fan waits for the train to stop at the next station. She opens the carriage door and posts up the numbers for 8 and 9 together. Several passengers exit the train and others enter. Ruixian Fan checks their tickets and makes sure they have found their sleeping quarters for the reminder of their journey.

description: In this clip, Satya leaves to go to his room to rest. Muttu sits at the Cyber Cafe where he helps a French lady converse with the Cyber Cafe owner (Muttu's friend) by being the translator. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Sao Paulo,Brazil,rap,hip-hop,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~00:08:07 - 00:30:28 - Life Story Part 2

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Zhanna Dosmailova, a child from Vannovka, Kazakhstan. She was 5 years old at the time of the shoot. Zhanna Dosmailova has grown up in an orphanage, though she is not an orphan herself. Her mother is the orphanage's director, and her father is its driver and maintenance manager. They live in Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, near the Tien Shan mountains. Five-year-old Zhanna and her two older brothers often play Wii and other games with the orphans, many of whom are Russian. She begins school in 2010. This video was produced by Simone Goldsmith, Nobuhiro Awata, Ruchika Muchala, Marco Lüthy, Asel Orumbayeva, and Lindee Hoshikawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Zhanna Dosmailova - Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, Kazakhstan - Kazakh (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~10:00:31 - 10:15:31

description: In this clip, Jamila is at home. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Jamila Jad - Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon - Arabic (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~16:11:53 - 16:26:55

description: In this clip, morning assembly ends with the national anthem and some physical exercises, and the students file into their classrooms. Edith takes her seat in a desk she shares with her friend Natasha in the last row. The teacher arrives and instructs the students to open their English books to The Hunter and His Dog. The class analyzes an illustration, searches for two words, reads the tale silently, and then answers the first 4 of 5 reading comprehension questions. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Ngwale Village,Malawi,student,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Edith Kaphuka - Ngwale Village, Zomba, Malawi - Nyanja (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~07:00:55 - 07:15:56

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dadah - Sarimukti Village, Jakarta, Indonesia - Sundanese (Global Lives Project, 2008) ~20:15:25 - 20:30:11

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~12:03:33 - 12:14:06

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Beirut,Lebanon,school,islam,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Jamila Jad - Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon - Arabic (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~20:43:06 - 20:55:07

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, everyone is eating in Rael's room. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~13:57:37 - 14:13:54

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Zhanna Dosmailova, a child from Vannovka, Kazakhstan. She was 5 years old at the time of the shoot. Zhanna Dosmailova has grown up in an orphanage, though she is not an orphan herself. Her mother is the orphanage's director, and her father is its driver and maintenance manager. They live in Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, near the Tien Shan mountains. Five-year-old Zhanna and her two older brothers often play Wii and other games with the orphans, many of whom are Russian. She begins school in 2010. This video was produced by Simone Goldsmith, Nobuhiro Awata, Ruchika Muchala, Marco Lüthy, Asel Orumbayeva, and Lindee Hoshikawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Rael gets out of shower. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~04:48:04 - 05:03:53

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Jamila is at dance class. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, the tattoo artist is outlining the tattoo. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~15:02:32 - 15:18:38

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dadah - Sarimukti Village, Jakarta, Indonesia - Sundanese (Global Lives Project, 2008) ~12:41:52 - 12:55:22

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Vojka,Srem District,Serbia,beekeeping,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Dusan Lazic - Vojka, Srem District, Serbia - Serbian (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~16:14:36 - 16:43:56

description: In this clip, Muttu leaves home after having dinner. He walks towards the main street where he can find a way to get back to the bazaar street at Hampi village. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~19:42:14 - 19:56:40

description: In this clip, the singing winds down. Rael takes a break, plays one more song and heads home. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Muttu heads back to the bus stop, where he chats with his colleagues. He also tries selling his postcards and guide books to a few tourists who enter Hampi Village in their vehicles. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dusan Lazic - Vojka, Srem District, Serbia - Serbian (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~14:20:29 - 14:47:24

description: In this clip, Edith and Memory return to the stream to wash dishes. On the way, Edith spots some wild fruit and beckons Memory who fears it's a trap set by her big sister. They arrive at the stream and get to work - singing songs and gossiping. They imagine what they'd do if that mysterious dog re-appears. Edith can't stand the cold, but Memory doesn't seem to mind. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Edith Kaphuka - Ngwale Village, Zomba, Malawi - Nyanja (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~05:00:40 - 05:15:41

description: In this clip, Muttu continues to sleep. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~13:33:29 - 13:45:23

description: In this clip, Cecilia wakes up the girls a few minutes past 4am - Edith gets up straight away, but Memory struggles to get out of bed. The filmmakers' cell phone alarm goes off and the rooster crows. The girls begin their morning chores. Edith lights a candle on a tipsy chair while Memory chops firewood. Cecilia instructs both girls to sweep outside the house. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Ngwale Village,Malawi,student,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Edith Kaphuka - Ngwale Village, Zomba, Malawi - Nyanja (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~04:00:32 - 04:15:33

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Tokyo,Japan,disabled,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~07:58:56 - 08:13:57

description: In this clip, Jamila is asleep. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Jamila Jad - Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon - Arabic (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~21:25:10 - 21:40:10

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dadah - Sarimukti Village, Jakarta, Indonesia - Sundanese (Global Lives Project, 2008) ~08:13:29 - 08:28:29

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Jamila is at home. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Zhanna Dosmailova, a child from Vannovka, Kazakhstan. She was 5 years old at the time of the shoot. Zhanna Dosmailova has grown up in an orphanage, though she is not an orphan herself. Her mother is the orphanage's director, and her father is its driver and maintenance manager. They live in Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, near the Tien Shan mountains. Five-year-old Zhanna and her two older brothers often play Wii and other games with the orphans, many of whom are Russian. She begins school in 2010. This video was produced by Simone Goldsmith, Nobuhiro Awata, Ruchika Muchala, Marco Lüthy, Asel Orumbayeva, and Lindee Hoshikawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Dusan Lazic - Vojka, Srem District, Serbia - Serbian (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~04:35:44 - 05:30:47

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~20:05:04 - 20:19:20

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~21:54:50 - 22:09:50

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Zhanna Dosmailova, a child from Vannovka, Kazakhstan. She was 5 years old at the time of the shoot. Zhanna Dosmailova has grown up in an orphanage, though she is not an orphan herself. Her mother is the orphanage's director, and her father is its driver and maintenance manager. They live in Vannovka, Southern Kazakhstan, near the Tien Shan mountains. Five-year-old Zhanna and her two older brothers often play Wii and other games with the orphans, many of whom are Russian. She begins school in 2010. This video was produced by Simone Goldsmith, Nobuhiro Awata, Ruchika Muchala, Marco Lüthy, Asel Orumbayeva, and Lindee Hoshikawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Jamila at home with her family. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. description: In this clip, Rael is hanging out in a room, watching TV. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. description: In this clip, Muttu continues to take Satya through the ruins in Hampi, as he explains the history. Satya continues to capture these on his camera, regularly. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~08:11:34 - 08:26:03

description: In this clip, Jamila is at dance class. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip Rael is sleeping with music on. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~09:22:13 - 09:39:05

description: Ruixian Fan is a long distance train attendant on the K165 from Xi'an to Kunming. She works the overnight shift. As the sun rises she pulls back the curtains in the hard and soft sleeper carriages. Some passengers are beginning to wake up. Ruixian Fan collects and refills the hot water thermoses for each compartment.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Tokyo,Japan,disabled,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~09:17:36 - 09:27:22

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~09:42:19 - 09:56:05

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dusan Lazic, a beekeeper and retired engineer from Vojka, Serbia. He was 57 years old at the time of the shoot. Dusan Lazic turned to beekeeping in 2004 after having difficulty finding work as an engineer. He lives in Vojka, Serbia. Born in 1942, he has experienced firsthand many of the tumultuous events that have shaped modern East European history, including the rise and fall of communism, the Yugoslav wars, and Serbian independence. In the evenings, Dusan sings and plays percussion with his friends in a pop-rock cover band called Time Machine. This video was produced by Robert Eagle, Marko Popovic, Juliane Bittencourt, Stefan Ivanovic, David Szepesi, Dragan Petrovic, Hes Mundt, Srdjan Srdjanov, Zeljko Drazovic, Ana Lakčevic, Stewart Weir, Emile Holba, and Max Kesberger. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Vojka,Srem District,Serbia,beekeeping,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Dusan Lazic - Vojka, Srem District, Serbia - Serbian (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~03:47:15 - 04:35:43

She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rumi Nagashima, a college student and girl scout troop leader from Tokyo, Japan. She was 22 years old at the time of the shoot. Rumi Nagashima was born in 1984 in Higashi-Koganei, a suburb of Tokyo, Japan. At the time of the Global Lives Project shoot, she was about to graduate from Atomi University with a degree in Management Studies, and had a job lined-up with Fujitsu as a systems engineer. Due to an accident in 2005, she lost the use of her right leg. Although Rumi can walk, she still uses a wheelchair to travel long distances. She has served as a Girl Scout mentor and has also lobbied towards the development of barrier-free cities that increase accessibility for the physically challenged. This video was produced by Irene Herrera, Ron Carr, Andreina Lairet, Nobuhiro Awata, Helio Ishii, Claudianna Blanco, Kiyomi Nakai, Wakako Iguchi, Mariko Nagaba, Chieko Kato, Erika Aragon, Simone Goldsmith, Mike Olsen, Jon Jameson, Sakura Ono, Samson Yee, Tiffany Wang, Yumi Garcia, and Dos Santos. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Tokyo,Japan,disabled,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rumi Nagashima - Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan - Japanese (Global Lives Project, 2007) ~15:46:48 - 16:01:27

description: In this clip, Rael is singing outside and playing guitar. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Sao Paulo,Brazil,rap,hip-hop,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Rael Feliciano - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil - Portuguese (Global Lives Project, 2006) ~00:15:10 - 00:31:41

description: In this clip, Muttu is taking Satya to the top of the hill to show him the sunrise point. He also narrates a few historic stories of Hampi, during this walk. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
subject: Hampi,Karnataka,India,globallivesproject,Global Lives Project,glp,globallives
title: Muttu Kumar - Hampi, Karnataka, India - Kannada (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~05:58:05 - 06:14:06

description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Rael Feliciano, a hip-hop singer and city permit inspector. He was 23 years old at the time of the shoot. Better known as Rael, Israel Feliciano was born and raised in Sao Paulo, Brazil. At the time of his GLP shoot in 2006, he was an emerging hip-hop artist who paid the bills working as a city permit inspector. Rael has been a performer since childhood, when he and his brother would break dance in the city center and at school competitions. He is heavily influenced by his musician father, despite the fact that his father prefers the more traditional Forro and Sertaneja music to hip-hop. This video was produced by Maria Laura Vilela Cesar, Ana Leonardo Nassar, Helio Ishii, Jessica Sklair, Jose Santos, Eduardo B. Pinto, Marcelo Vitali, Erick Mammoccio, Pedro Gomes, Fabiano Pierri, Jarbas Viana, Gabriela Herman, Anita Goes, Daniel Malva, Alder Augusto, David Evan Harris, Jeovany Pinto Almeida, Manuel Palavras, Paulo Sergio de Paula, Fernando Bastos, and Camila Ogawa. description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. This video was produced by Jason Price, Ya-Hsuan Huang, Elasto Chanza, Jessie Levandov, Harrson Topp, Single Limodze, Blackwell Lungu, Z. Allan Ntata, Villant Ndasowa, Jos Garric, Arnold Mboga, Tom Likambale, Catherine Makhumula, Jessie Kabwila Kapasula, Allan Z. Nkata, and Dr. Sam Mchombo. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, the girls set off for school, with Memory joining Edith and Lindiwe along the path after checking in on their neighbor, Simeon. The sisters cross paths with Rebecca who's returning home with a bucket of water and won't be attending school. Lindiwe proves too slow, so Edith carries her the rest of the way. The girls are late and Edith wonders if she should play sick. Memory has a Chichewa test at school today. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Edith Kaphuka, a student from Ngwale Village, Zomba District, Malawi. She was 13 years old at the time of the shoot. Edith Kaphuka was a 13-year-old student at Domasi Mission Primary School in Zomba District, Malawi during her Global Lives Project shoot in 2007. The oldest of four girls, Edith has many responsibilities at her home in Ngwale Village, such as fetching water, cleaning the dishes, and gardening. Her little sister, Memory, is her best friend; when the two are together, they are nearly inseparable. While Edith and her family are Yao, they more readily speak Chichewa, Malawi's national language. description: This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Dadah, a farmer from Sarimukti Village, Indonesia. She was 32 years old at the time of the shoot. Dadah is a mother of three from Sarimukti, a Sundanese village in the highlands of West Java. She and her husband are farm workers on a state-owned plantation that dates back to Dutch colonial days. They are practicing Muslims and active members of the Pasundan Farmers' Union, which lobbies for both land re-distribution among farmers and children's education. This video was produced by Khairani Barokka, Endah Wahyu Sulistianti, Rian Suryalibrata, Truly Hitosoro, Antonius Riva, Setiawan, Ratih Prebatasari, Yuslam Fikri Ansari, Edsa M. Hashmi, Wawan Gunawan, Hendro Sangkoyo, Edi, Yogi, Bani, Dasaat, Iwan Setiawan, Lexy Rambadeta, and Vina. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

description: In this clip, Jamila is in school. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Jamila Jad, an elementary school student from Beirut, Lebanon. She was 9 years old at the time of the shoot. Born from a Lebanese mother and a Palestinian father, Jamila Jad inherited the nationality of her father. She is one of 400,000 officially registered Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. Jamila was born and raised in Shatila refugee camp in Beirut, where she attends public school and dreams of becoming a doctor. The oldest of four children, Jamila shoulders many responsibilities at home. Her father has been fighting Hepatitis C, and her mother works a cleaning job to keep the family afloat. This video was produced by Ron Carr, Irene Herrera, Lindee Hoshikawa, Chahid Akhoury, Lucie Kroening, Kassem Aina, Simone Goldsmith, and Zohour Akkawi. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.

title: Jamila Jad - Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon - Arabic (Global Lives Project, 2009) ~12:57:55 - 13:02:56

description: In this clip, Muttu has his dinner while watching television. His mother interacts with one of the crew members in the local language. This is part of a 24-hour recording of a day in the life of Muttu Kumar, a postcard seller and tour guide from Hampi, India. He was 18 years old at the time of the shoot. Despite leaving school at age twelve due to financial constraints, Muttu Kumar speaks Hindi, Kannada, English, and a fair bit of French. These skills are central to his work as a tour guide and postcard salesman in Hampi, India where the architectural achievements of the Vijaynagar Empire have been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. He works to support himself and his family, who live in a village two miles from the town. This video was produced by Srikumar Venkatraman, Ruhie Kumar, Deepa Bhat, Meghna Madhusudan, Rahul V. Chittella, Vishal Gupta, Akash Mohimen, Omkar Parab, Abhishek, Zainab Burmawala, Brijesh Matalia, Nagyaraj, Bassappa, and Meera Sankar. This video is part of the Global Lives Project, a video library of life experience. For more information see globallives.org.
